title: Revital Amoyal
text:
Revital Amoyal (born 10 October 1977) is an Israeli former <a href="women%27s%20soccer">football</a> <a href="Striker%20%28association%20football%29">striker</a>.
Club career.
Born in <a href="Ashdod">Ashdod</a>, Amoyal joined <a href="Ligat%20Nashim">Ligat Nashim</a> club <a href="Hapoel%20Tel%20Aviv%20F.C.%20%28women%29">Hapoel Tel Aviv</a> upon its formation, and stayed with the club until retiring at the age of 25, in 2003. With Hapoel Tel Aviv, Amoyal won a domestic double in <a href="2001%E2%80%9302%20in%20Israeli%20football">2001–02</a>, winning both the <a href="2000%E2%80%9301%20Ligat%20Nashim">League</a> and <a href="2000%E2%80%9301%20Israeli%20Women%27s%20Cup">Cup</a>. As the club qualified to the <a href="2001%E2%80%9302%20UEFA%20Women%27s%20Cup">2001–02 UEFA Women's Cup</a>, Amoyal played in all three group stage matches with the club.
Amoyal made her debut with the <a href="Israel%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">National team</a> on 2 September 2001, playing against <a href="Austria%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Austria</a>. Amoyal played five matches with the national team, the last on 6 June 2002, in a <a href="2003%20FIFA%20Women%27s%20World%20Cup%20qualification%20%28UEFA%29">2003 FIFA Women's World Cup qualification</a> match against <a href="Croatia%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Croatia</a>.
